availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
9
The Governor appointed the following Aids with the ranks of Colonel. Jno. W. Adams of Garrard Sam. C. Sayres of Franklin Vene P. Armstrong of Hardin, John Hayden of Clay, Jno S. Hargis of Breathitt. E B. Treadway and J. Ewing Gibson of Owsley County.
He approved an account of $25. to W. P. Jones for work done at State Arsenal Certified by the Qr M. Genl correct
He remitted the following Judgments, to wit:

row.cell: Harrison Cir. Ct vs. H I Righter

body.p:
Feby 9
The Governor nominated to the Senate the following persons to be Notaries Public in the counties named. to wit
Sherrod Burton for Boyle, Jno. C Hansbro. for Fayette, J. J. Hawes, Wm Muir, J. F Bullitt, J. R. Montgomery, C. H. Barclay, P. B. Poindexter, H A. Shaeffer Jas A. Terrill, and W. E. Robinson for Jefferson, W R. Welch for Jessamine O. A. Patten and P S Bush for Kenton Jas W. Alcorn for Lincoln, Jos McGroty for Mercer. Thos E Moss for McCracken, Noah Spears for Scott, John McNeal for Shelby and D. H. Hughes and L W Long for Union County which nominations were duly Confirmed
Also W. E Price and Jas S. Phelps, (heretofore appointed) to be Managers of the Western Lunatic Asylum also confirmed
He approved and signed enrolled bills Chapters 114 to 131 inclusive.
